judges: Before McCollum, C. J., Mitchell, Fell, Beown, Mesteezat and Pottee, JJ.

opinions.text:
Feb Cubiam,
Upon due consideration we affirm the decree complained of by the appellant on the opinion of the learned judge of the orphans’ court.
Decree affirmed and appeal dismissed at the cost of the appellant.
opinions.author: Feb Cubiam,

attorneys: Henry A. Miller, with him J. N, Piatt, for appellant.
JE. H. Flick, with him M. M. McNeil, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Connolly’s Estate
(No. 2).
Argued Oct. 24, 1900.
Appeal, No. 103, Oct. T., 1900, by the Safe Deposit and Trust Company of Pittsburg, administrator d. b. n. c. t. a. of the estate of Martin Connoly, deceased, from decree of O. C. Allegheny Co., Noy. T., 1899, No. 65, dismissing exceptions to adjudication in the estate of Martin Connolly, deceased.
Before McCollum, C. J., Mitchell, Fell, Beown, Mesteezat and Pottee, JJ.
Affirmed.
Exceptions to adjudication.
The facts appear by the opinion of Ovee, P. J., in the preceding case.
Henry A. Miller, with him J. N, Piatt, for appellant.
JE. H. Flick, with him M. M. McNeil, for appellee.
January 7, 1901:
